intro: Chromolaena ponsiae, commonly known as the Ponsae false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a rough texture with serrated edges. Chromolaena ponsiae is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands due to its adaptability and rapid growth rate.
